newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Oct 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Oct 28.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories on Monday:
- Oracle Corp and Netscape Communications Corp are expected to announce on Monday that they will endorse each other's products in a new alliance.
- Apple Computer Inc plans to launch on Monday a new computer for elementary and high schools that will cost half as much as the multimedia systems being used today.
- General Motors Corp and the Canadian Automobile Workers union rush towards a final agreement for a labor contract under the pressures of an approaching deadline.
- The Kelley Blue Book Co is putting its lists of used car prices onto the Internet.
- Mexico's government reached an agreement with the country's business and labor leaders to keep wages at the same level and maintain an austerity plan.
- The decline in AT&T Corp's stock following the appointment of a new president shows how Wall Street was not impressed with the company's choice.
- Wall Street is not as bullish about Internet companies like CompuServe Corp as had been expected because it wants to see more growth and profits.
- Competition between cable news networks has spread to the Internet as the Cable News Network of Turner Broadcasting System Inc and others create home pages offering stories and other information.
- The World Wide Web is eliminating the ability of government regulators to control gambling, especially on the Internet.
- Religious bookstores are not selling as many Bibles as they used to.
